DOC.brief_summary: This study aim evaluate effect add magnesium sulphate epidurally adjunct levobupivacaine quality anesthesia perioperative pain relief patient preeclampsia undergoing elective caesarian section ( CS ) .
DOC.brief_title: Adding MgSO4 Epidural Levobupivacaine CS Patients With Preeclampsia
DOC.detailed_description: Pregnant woman preeclampsia undergo elective CS include study . All patient participate study randomly divide two group ; magnesium sulphate group ( study group ) placebo group ( control group ) . Patients study group receive epidural 20 ml levobupivacaine hydrochloride 0.5 % plus 5 ml magnesium sulphate 10 % ( 500 mg ) patient control group receive epidural 20 ml levobupivacaine hydrochloride 0.5 % plus 5 ml saline 0.9 % .
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman preeclampsia undergo elective CS . Age < 20 > 35 year . Height < 150 > 180 cm . Body mass index ( BMI ) > 35 kg/m2 . Active labor . Multifetal pregnancy . Fetal distress . Medical condition complicate pregnancy . HELLP syndrome . Thrombocytopenia . Hepatic renal impairment . Pulmonary edema cyanosis . Placenta previa . Vaginal bleed placental abruption . Contraindication central neuraxial block . History adverse reaction study medication . History analgesic use . Magnesium therapy . Chronic pain syndrome . Presence communication difficulty prevent reliable assessment . Refusal undergo regional anesthesia .
